Title: Savage Island

reviewText: SAVAGE ISLAND begins w/ a woman, submerged in mud / quicksand (quick-mud?), being killed by a large snake. The scene switches to a woman named Daly (Linda Blair) walking into a high-rise, pulling a gun, and shooting a security guard (Penn Gillette!!) in the forehead! Daly's there to tell her former employer about her mistreatment at the hands of his jungle thugs. Of course, this is done using flashbacks of events having nothing to do w/ Daly. The "story" has something to do w/ emeralds, and those profiting from them. However, it's mostly scenes of sweaty women fighting, sweaty men murdering each other, and more sweaty women losing their clothes while fighting. This is punctuated by the occasional narration of Ms. Blair, reminding us that this monotonous mess is supposed to make some sort of sense. Not even the near-constant barrage of full-frontal female nudity can help to ease the agony of this dog-log! Whew!...
summary: "I Can Tell You're A Woman Who Drives A Hard Bargain!"...
Title: Savage Island

reviewText: You will like this movie, as that seems to be the main point of this movie. Linda Blair is kind of the narrator of the film. The acting is poor, and the script left a lot to be desired. Some action sequences late in the film, and ends with Linda Blair and a machine gun. You would probably be better off spending 90 minutes elsewhere.

reviewText: I used to hate people that gave bad reviews about not the movie but the quality of the DVD, until I started buying DVD's and wasting money on bad quality ones so I have realized that those kinda reviews, about bad quality DVDs where the exterior night shots are impossible to see and the picture is grainy like a third rate VHS left in the sun... I realized that I too will warn the lot of you, do not buy this crappy quality DVD, it's a waste of your money.

reviewText: I'd give it no stars if I could. Reason I even tried to watch: was in the mood for a so-bad-it's-funny-movie for a few minutes.  Skipped through it...fast..and couldn't finish it.  Life's too short.  Bad is too good of a rating thus my worse-than-awful title.  Filmed in some banana republic with English voice overs, terrible acting, worse film quality  (and that's saying something considering how terrible the acting is) - not to mention the incredibly inane plot, I couldn't come close to finishing it.  I figured if I had time to watch this movie, my life may not be worth living.
Title: Savage Island

reviewText: I can't believe I got through this whole movie. It is really, really awful, but in a fun way. Lovely ladies whose acting abilities simply defy description.Perhaps the saving grace was the brilliant portrayal of a door man by a young Penn Gillette (Teller was nowhere to be seen.) Seldom has there been such a match of actor and role. Why he did not receive a best supporting actor Oscar for this film is incomprehensible!If you have literally NOTHING else to do, you must watch this grisly live action cartoon. You will be amazed that you actually did.
Title: Savage Island

reviewText: I mean, what do you say about a film that plays creepy porn lounge music behind a forced shower scene as if to say "Forget about the forced labor and sexual abuse, These enslaved women are sexy when they shower". Creepy, seriously creepy.
Title: Savage Island

reviewText: I decided to give this flik a try after hearing Charles Band of Full Moon Pictures describe its' genesis in the rap he gives as part of the extras in all of the newly re-issued "Grindhouse Collection" from Full Moon. At a point in the past Band apparently found a bunch of sleazy WIP style foreign made films and purchased the rights to them... then re-packaged one of them (as "Savage Island') with a wrap-around story line featuring Linda Blair - in order to give the film a bit of Hollywood Star Power draw for the domestic market.Personally, altho I'm as big a fan of Linda's work as any, I was more drawn to the film by the promise of some good hard WIP action such as foreign directors (like Jess Franco) can sometimes deliver.  Unfortunately, the product provided by the Full Moon "Savage Island" package is flawed by a very poor transfer which renders the viewing experience sub-par. As other reviewers have noted - this is particularly annoying during any dark night-time scenes - which are virtually un-viewable -  as well as hindering a full appreciation of the many scenes of naked female flesh - that are likely what one would purchase this product to enjoy in the first place.But, for any die-hard WIP fans who wished that they could actually SEE what is contained in this twisted little flik - please be aware that there is a MUCH BETTER VERSION available.  A little probing around on the internet provided the additional info that this film (in its' original release) was actually an Italian effort (filmed in South America) entitled "Hotel Paradis(e)" (aka "Escape From Hell").  This original (widescreen!) version of the film is available with a MUCH better picture quality from: Amazon.co.uk (Britain). Sold as: "Hotel Paradis - the Strong Uncut Version" this is a Swedish release (w/ dubbed English sound). The Euro-disk actually contains 2 separate versions of the film - the 'theatrical' release and a version re-assembled from multiple sources - that provides 'inserts' of 'deleted' hardcore XXX scenes that 'extend' several of the sex scenes portrayed in the film.  These 'hardcore' scenes are relatively degenerated when compared to the rest of the film's sharp visual quality, but they are (ironically) about as ' clear(NOT)' as the quality of ALL of the Full Moon 'Savage Island' version! While the X rated material adds little to the story-line it IS nice to have the option to view it - AND - there IS one scene involving 'a pipe' that takes on a special nuance when viewed in the hard-core context! Of course there's no Linda Blair in the 'original' movie - AND - the Euro-Region 2 PAL DVD requires a 'region-free' player to view! - something that every mondo-weirdo movie fanatic should invest in!The Euro-version of this nasty little piece of jungle based sexploitation does deliver the goods that WIP hounds hope to find. Ample female nudity throughout - plenty of sex - a 'classic' 2 girls tied together whipping scene, and lotsa 'showers'. The primary female leads are plenty attractive! - Eurasian hottie Christina Lai gets pretty 'explicit'- as does the impressive Ajita Wilson - baring all - she's arguably the hottest female of the bunch even though 'she' was apparently originally a MAN - letz hear it for modern medicine!  For the "Euro "Hotel Paradis" version - 4.5 stars!I'm generally 'liking' the new crop of 'Grindhouse" product that Full Moon has been releasing, but the picture quality, and content, IS pretty variable from feature to feature.  In the case of "Savage Island" the image quality is poor and really detracts from the over-all enjoyment - so, despite the fact that it is packed full of all the good stuff that one looks for in this type of flik, I can't give the Full Moon version more than an 'average' grade.
summary: 4 Anyone Who Cares - a WAY Better Version Exists! (across the pond)...
Title: Savage Island

reviewText: This is a fairly hard movie to find, and was only looking for it as a hardcore Blair fan. Blair is barely even in the movie: just a few minutes at the beginning and a few at the end. A inadvertently humorous exploitation flick using the women in prison/women in chains motif. Was wondering why this hadn't been updated to dvd and is only available on vhs. Well, perhaps because it's, mmmmm..........not so good.

reviewText: This is big piece of badly sutured celluloid. Two or three badly dubbed Spanish/Italian produced movies tied together with a wraparound segment starring Linda Blair and introducing Pen Jillette in his first big screen movie role! I couldn't even watch it for fun. The bad synthesizer music of the soundtrack and the bad dubbing and the poorly lit scenes drove me crazy.
summary: I see what you did there...
Title: Savage Island
